ml_projects.projectDescription: A food image classifier that uses convolutional neural networks (Keras framework). Inspired from the app "SeeFood", as shown on HBO's Silicon Valley. Also has a web interface that can download images from any URL and classify them.

A twitter sentiment analyzer that used support vector machines and natural language processing (scikit-learn, and NLTK framework). Used the word frequency map method to build vectors (after stopword removal, POS tagging and spelling correction) and the one versus all SVM method.

A document categorizer that uses support vector machines and neural networks (used Neuroph, and libsvm framework). Used the word frequency map method to build vectors (after stopword removal, and special character removal) and the one versus all SVM method. On the other hand, a multi-perceptron neural network was used. Achieved a 100% accuracy on BBC and 89% on the Heckyl Database.

Built a portfolio generator that used machine learning to extrapolate past data and predict stock movement. Implemented the iterative gradient descent algorithm and linear algebra operations from scratch in C++. Back tested the application with data from the Bombay Stock Exchange - on average, the portfolio generated by the application comprised of 60% winners and 40% losers.
Educational Chatbot built as my Senior Capstone Project at NYU Tandon School of Engineering (winner of the Best Design Award at the Senior Captsone Competition).

A Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) trained to colorize images using single shot learning. Works very well for images from the same relative distribution, such as for comic books, potraits and similar artwork.
My UC Berkeley Masters' Capstone Project. Worked on the dataset provided by Facebook's DFDC Challenge to create a generalizable deepfake detector based on Google's EfficientNet CNN architecture.

mobile_apps.projectDescription: Inspired by the presence of completely, empty spaces in outer space, Void is an app that allows people to vent out without guilt or the fear of social embarrassment.

Navy Dolphin aims to be the anti-thesis of the predatory 'Blue Whale' game that prompts innocent people to take their lives. Navy Dolphin focuses on positivity and aims to spread happiness by asking its users to perform one happy deed a day.

web_apps.projectDescription: Made the company website and blog for Abakkus Asset Manager LLC, a new finance company located in Mumbai, India. Also handled the creation of their company blog and did some technical consulting.

A messaging application I built with my co-peers as a project for my databases class. It has a number of features like a personalized color picker, a versatile content viewer, and ability to have custom groups. The front-end was created using HTML, CSS and Python. The back-end was a MySQL database.
A chatbot proof-of-concept I built during my Summer 2019 Internship at Play Games 24x7 in Node.js, React.js, Express.js and MongoDB. The chatbot was able to resolve 6 out of the top 10 asked queries.
A research project that I did for my advanced algorithms class at NYU explaining how KD Trees worked and a visual demonstration of the data structure using the p5 javascript library.
Bliss is a bucket list application that I built for my INFO 290T class at UC Berkeley. Built in javascript, it focuses on providing a clean user interface and minimal features.
